Template.title: Medication Statement
Template.Description: Formerly called "Medication Activity". This represents the EVN mood of a medication activity.
Template.Notes: **August 2015 Update**: This profile was previously named "Medication Activity". It was renamed to avoid confusion. It represents the EVN mood code of a medication activity. It is a sister profile to Medication Prescription, which represents the INT mood code a medication activity. This one has a lot of templates that are contained in Consolidation. I'm not sure which ones to include: - Drug Vehicle - Indication - Instructions - Medication Supply Order - Medication Dispense - Reaction Observation - Precondition for Substance administration

Template.title: History of Present Illness section
Template.Description: The History of Present Illness section describes the history related to the reason for the encounter. It contains the historical details leading up to and pertaining to the patients current complaint or reason for seeking medical care.

Template.title: Physical Exam section
Template.Description: The Physical Exam section includes direct observations made by the clinician. The examination may include the use of simple instruments and may also describe simple maneuvers performed directly on the patients body. This section includes only observations made by the examining clinician using inspection, palpation, auscultation, and percussion; it does not include laboratory or imaging findings. The exam may be limited to pertinent body systems based on the patients chief complaint or it may include a comprehensive examination. The examination may be reported as a collection of random clinical statements or it may be reported categorically. The Physical Exam section may contain multiple nested subsections: Vital Signs, General Status, and those listed in the Additional Physical Examination Subsections appendix.

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] address (CONF:1150-298).

This address SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] line (CONF:1150-300).
Constraint.Description: C-CDA R1.1: *SHALL* contain exactly one [1..1] streetAddressLine (CONF:7291). Because nullFlavor is allowed in C-CDA streetAddressLine, FHIR profile line is *SHOULD* 0..1 - transforms between CDA and FHIR will need to take nullFlavor into account.

Constraint.NarrativeText: This address SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] city (CONF:1150-301).
Constraint.Description: C-CDA R1.1: *SHALL* contain exactly one [1..1] city (CONF:7292). Because nullFlavor is allowed in C-CDA city, FHIR profile city is *SHOULD* 0..1 - transforms between CDA and FHIR will need to take nullFlavor into account.

Constraint.NarrativeText: This address SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] state, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet StateValueSet urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.1 DYNAMIC (CONF:1150-302).
Constraint.Description: C-CDA R1.1: State is required if the country is US. If country is not specified, it's assumed to be US. If country is something other than US, the state *MAY* be present but *MAY* be bound to different vocabularies (CONF:10024)

Constraint.NarrativeText: This address SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] zip, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet PostalCode urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.2 DYNAMIC (CONF:1150-303).
Constraint.Description: C-CDA R1.1: PostalCode is required if the country is US. If country is not specified, it's assumed to be US. If country is something other than US, the postalCode *MAY* be present but *MAY* be bound to different vocabularies (CONF:10025)

Template.title: Plan of Care Activities
Template.Description: This is a wrapper for one or more Planned Observation, Planned Procedure, etc. resources. There is no equivalent in Consolidated CDA, but is needed in Camara since sections are represented by List resources. If we supported a CarePlan resource as a section then this would actually be the Care Plan Section template. However, FHIR DSTU 2 binds sections to List anyway, so this approach is actually forwards compatible.

Template.title: Diagnostic Imaging Report
Template.Description: A Diagnostic Imaging Report (DIR) is a document that contains a consulting specialist's interpretation of image data. It conveys the interpretation to the referring (ordering) physician and becomes part of the patient's medical record. It is for use in Radiology, Endoscopy, Cardiology, and other imaging specialties.
